alert.note: Alert for Douglas (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 17 at 5:10PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT EAST CENTRAL AITKIN... SOUTHERN ST. LOUIS...CARLTON...SOUTHWESTERN LAKE AND NORTHWESTERN DOUGLAS COUNTIES... At 509 PM CST, moderate to heavy snow showers were along a line extending from near Tower, to 6 miles east of Meadowlands, to near McGregor, and moving east at 45 mph. Visibilities of 1 mile or less, wind gusts up to 20 to 30 mph, and rapid snow accumulation on roads are expected with these moderate to heavy snow showers. These moderate to heavy snow showers will be near... Hoyt Lakes, Aurora, Biwabik, Embarrass, Tower, Cotton, Cromwell, Brookston, Canyon, and Fond Du Lac Band Sawyer Area around 515 PM CST. Bear Head Lake State Park around 520 PM CST. Cloquet, Babbitt, Saginaw, Island Lake, Whiteface Reservoir, and Fond Du Lac Band Cloquet Area around 525 PM CST. Pike Lake Near Duluth, Boulder Lake, and Birch Lake around 530 PM CST. Duluth, Hermantown, Scanlon, Barnum, Mahtowa, and City of Rice Lake around 535 PM CST. Proctor, Carlton, Thomson, Fairbanks, Wolf Lake, and Jay Cooke State Park around 540 PM CST. Wrenshall, Brimson, and Nemadji around 545 PM CST. Superior, Oliver, French River, and McQuade Harbor around 550 PM CST. Other locations impacted by these moderate to heavy snow showers include Franklin, Cody, Billings Park, Seven Beaver Lake, Wales, Gary New Duluth, Fish Lake, Soudan, Spirit Valley, and Bear Head Lake. Be prepared for changing visibility and road conditions. Reduce your speed and allow more space between you and the vehicle in front of you.
